title: Library Book Tracker
description: Create a simple library system with a Book data class and a Library class that can add and find books.
instructions: Create a data class Book(title, author) and a Library class with addBook() and findByAuthor() methods. Add two books and search by author.

testCases.expectedOutput: Found: Kotlin in Action by Dmitry Jemerov

hints.text: Use data class Book(val title: String, val author: String)
Library should have a private MutableList<Book>
Use filter { it.author == author } for findByAuthor

commonMistakes.mistake: Using regular class instead of data class
commonMistakes.correction: Use data class for simple value holders

commonMistakes.consequence: External code can modify the list directly
commonMistakes.correction: Keep the list private, expose methods

commonMistakes.mistake: Returning null instead of empty list
commonMistakes.correction: Return an empty list when no books match
